result.execSummary:
The defendant Laharry Lemon Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laharry Lemon Ward

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion to Vacate Order Requiring Reimbursement for Attorney's Fees and Costs

Defendant Laharry Lemon Ward in court.  Attorney William F Sulton in court for Laharry Lemon Ward.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea. Hearing proceeded. Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1 : Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

Defendant ordered to serve 45 days in the House of Correction, Huber privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:

Conditions of Probation
- Anger management course.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- 15 hours of community service.
- No contact with SGS.
- No violent contact with Rocket Ship School .
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Restitution set at $0. 
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 

Court orders defendant to report for Probation Intake and DNA swab by end of day 11-04-2022.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Laharry Lemon Ward appeared by video.  Attorney William F Sulton appeared by video for Laharry Lemon Ward.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense requested a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-18-2022
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.  rmm
Court ordered JusticePoint supervision be lowered to Level 3.  All other conditions remain.

Defendant Laharry Lemon Ward in court.  Attorney William F Sulton in court for Laharry Lemon Ward.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Sulton requests another status date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 09-07-2022, filed.  rmm
Signed and filed
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 07-29-2022 to repay Milwaukee County$50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 09-01-2022. Other cases include 22CM1567

Defendant Laharry Lemon Ward in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom.   Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints William Sulton as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Sulton accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 09/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Sent to Judge for review
Received and Filed.

Case calendared for an initial appearance. Defendant appeared in court in person. Defendant already had an initial appearance on this case, so the court gave the defendant a reminder slip for their next court date that was previously scheduled. 
Next court date is a pre-trial conference before Judge Davila, Branch 1 on July 28th, 2022 at 1:30 -- BY ZOOM.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SGS, Rocketship School 5501 N. 68th Street, Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, WI.   Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Laharry Lemon Ward in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Laharry Lemon Ward in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Laharry Lemon Ward

Prior: 8031 North 47th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-5-2022 @2:30p
